BiblioData.Title: WAVEGUIDE HAVING LOW INDEX SUBSTRATE
BiblioData.Abstract: An optical waveguide (160) includes a porous substrate (122) having pores (154) of first width (166), a barrier layer (104) having apertures (152) aligned with the pore openings, and a core material layer (162) adjacent the barrier layer. The apertures have a second width (164) less than the first width.

Claims.P: An optical waveguide (160) comprising: a porous substrate (122) having pores (154) of a first width (166); a barrier layer (104) having apertures (152) aligned with the pore openings, the apertures having a second width (164) less than the first width; and a core material layer (162) adjacent the barrier layer.
2. The optical waveguide of claim 1, wherein the porous substrate comprises anodic alumina.
3. The optical waveguide of claim 1 , wherein the barrier layer comprises relatively pure alumina.
4. The optical waveguide of claim 1 , wherein the barrier layer comprises a chemically stable oxide.
5. The optical waveguide of claim 1 , wherein the core material comprises silicon.
6. The optical waveguide of claim 1 , wherein the porous substrate has a porosity within a range of approximately 70% - 95%.
7. The optical waveguide of claim 1 , wherein the porous substrate has an index of refraction less than approximately 1.2.
8. The optical waveguide of claim 1, wherein the waveguide is a photonic crystal waveguide or a ridge waveguide.
9. The optical waveguide of claim 1, wherein the porous substrate has a thickness less than approximately 2[mu]m.

10. A method of fabricating a waveguide (160), the method comprising: forming a barrier layer (104) on a substrate (102); forming apertures (152) through the barrier layer and pores (154) in the substrate aligned with the apertures; widening the pores of the substrate; and depositing core material (162) on the barrier layer.
